required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: AllogeneiC Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells (hMSC) in Patients With Aging FRAilTy Via IntravenoUS Delivery
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II, Randomized, Blinded and Placebo-controlled Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Potential Efficacy of Allogeneic Human Mesenchymal Stem Cell Infusion in Patients With Aging Frailty

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to look at the safety of treatment with stem cells in patients with Frailty.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Any Treatment Emergent - Serious Adverse Events (TE-SAEs)
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of any treatment-emergent serious adverse events (SAE), defined as the composite of: death, non-fatal pulmonary embolism, stroke, hospitalization for worsening dyspnea and clinically significant laboratory test abnormalities. Serum chemistry: chloride, bicarbonate, blood urea nitrogen (BUN), creatinine, glucose, calcium, aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), total bilirubin (fractionate if total >1.5 times normal), alkaline phosphatase, albumin, Hematology (Complete blood count): hemoglobin, hematocrit, platelets, white blood cells (WBC), WBC differential

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Frailty as Assessed by CHAMPS Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 6 month follow-up visit.
secondary_outcome.description: Community Healthy Activities Model Program for Seniors (CHAMPS) questionnaire measures duration of exercise-related activities (hours/week). The Duration variable can range from 0 - 399.75 hours per week. Higher scores indicate more activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Slowing of Mobility as Measured by 4 Meter Gait Speed Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 6 month follow-up visit.
secondary_outcome.description: 4-meter gait speed test measures the time (in seconds) taken to walk a distance of 4 meters. The total score has a range of 1 point - 4 points with the higher score indicating faster walk speed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Slowing of Mobility as Measured by SPPB
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 6 month follow-up visit.
secondary_outcome.description: Standard Physical Performance Battery (SPPB) Assessment has total score ranging from 0-4 with the higher score indicating better balance.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 6 month follow-up visit.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in weight as measured in kilograms (kg).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Diminished Hand Grip Strength
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 6 month follow-up visit.
secondary_outcome.description: Hand grip strength as assessed by a dynamometer. Grip strength is recorded (in mmHg) three times for each hand. The average reading is reported for each hand.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Exhaustion as Measured by the MFI Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 6 month follow-up visit.
secondary_outcome.description: Multi-dimensional Fatigue Inventory (MFI) Questionnaire contains 20 questions with a 5-point scale. The MFI has total score ranging from 20-100 with the higher score indicating less fatigue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life (QoL) as Measured by the ICECAP Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 6 month follow-up visit.
secondary_outcome.description: Investigating Choice Experiences for the Preferences of Older People (ICEpop) Capability measure for Older people (ICECAP) questionnaire has total score ranging from 5-20 with the higher score indicating greater quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life (QoL) as Measured by the SF-36 Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 6 month follow-up visit.
secondary_outcome.description: Short Form (SF)-36 Questionnaire has consists of eight scaled scores, which are the weighted sums of the questions in their section. Each scale is directly transformed into a 0-100 scale. Lower scores indicate the more disability, and higher scores indicate less disability.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life (QoL) as Measured by the EQ-5D-3L Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 6 month follow-up visit.
secondary_outcome.description: EuroQoL (EQ)- 5 Dimension (5D)- 3 levels (3L) Questionnaire has total score ranging from 0-10 for the 5 dimensions. Higher scores indicate better Quality of Life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life (QoL) as Measured by the EQ-5D-3L Overall Health Status Scale.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 6 month follow-up visit.
secondary_outcome.description: EuroQoL - 5 Dimension - 3 levels (EQ-5D-3L) Overall health status question has a range of 0-100. Higher scores indicate better Quality of Life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Sense of Smell as Measured by UPSIT
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 6 month follow-up visit.
secondary_outcome.description: University of Pennsylvania Smell Identification Test (UPSIT) smell test booklet has a total score ranging from 0-40 with higher scores indicating better olfaction.
Any reported death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 6 month follow-up visit.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in dobutamine stress echocardiogram induced ejection fraction

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 6 month follow-up visit.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in inflammatory markers including C-Reactive Protein (CRP) and Fibrinogen serum samples as measured in mg/L.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 6 month follow-up visit.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in inflammatory markers including Interleukin (IL)-6 and Tumor Necrosis Factor (TNF) Alpha from serum samples as measured in pg/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Inflammatory Marker D-dimer Levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 6 month follow-up visit.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in inflammatory marker D-Dimer from serum samples as measured in mg/dL.

arm_group.description: Group 1 participants will receive Allogeneic Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells (allo-hMSCs): 20 million allo-hMSCs/kg delivered via peripheral intravenous infusion. Participants in this group have the option to receive an additional 3 infusions of 100million allo-hMSCs/kg per infusion with a 12 to 18 month interval.

Group 2 - Allogeneic Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells (allo-hMSCs): 100 million allo-hMSCs/kg delivered via peripheral intravenous infusion. Participants in this group have the option to receive an additional 3 infusions of 100million allo-hMSCs/kg per infusion with a 12 to 18 month interval.

Group 3 - Allogeneic Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells (allo-hMSCs): 200 million allo-hMSCs/kg delivered via peripheral intravenous infusion. Participants in this group have the option to receive an additional 3 infusions of 100million allo-hMSCs/kg per infusion with a 12 to 18 month interval.
Group A - Allogeneic Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells (allo-hMSCs): 100 million allo-hMSCs/kg delivered via peripheral intravenous infusion.
Group B - Allogeneic Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells (allo-hMSCs): 200 million allo-hMSCs/kg delivered via peripheral intravenous infusion.

Group C - Placebo delivered via peripheral intravenous infusion. Participants in this group have the option to receive one additional infusion of 100million allo-hMSCs/kg with a 12 to 18 month interval.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Addendum B - Antibiotic free cell Group
arm_group.description: Allogeneic Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells (allo-hMSCs): 100 million penicillin/streptomycin-free allo-hMSCs/kg delivered via peripheral intravenous infusion. Participants in this group have the option to receive an additional 3 infusions of 100million allo-hMSCs/kg per infusion with a 12 to 18 month interval.

intervention.description: Allogeneic Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells (allo-hMSCs) administered by peripheral intravenous infusion
intervention.arm_group_label: Addendum B - Antibiotic free cell Group

intervention.description: Placebo administered by peripheral intravenous infusion.

intervention.intervention_name: Penicillin/Streptomycin-Free Allogeneic Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells (allo-hMSCs)
intervention.description: Penicillin/Streptomycin-Free Allogeneic Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells (allo-hMSCs) administered by peripheral intravenous infusion.
intervention.arm_group_label: Addendum B - Antibiotic free cell Group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provide written informed consent.
- Subjects age greater than or equal to 60 and less than or equal to 95 years at the time of signing the Informed Consent Form.
- Show signs of frailty apart from a concomitant condition as assessed by the Investigator with a frailty score of 4 to 7 using the Clinical Frailty Scale
- Female subjects with an Follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) equal to or > 25.8 milli-international units (mIU) /mL (milliliter), if not currently on hormone replacement therapy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Score of less than or equal to 24 on the Mini Mental State Examination (MMSE)
- Inability to perform any of the assessments required for endpoint analysis (report safety or tolerability concerns, perform pulmonary function tests, undergo blood draws, read and respond to questionnaires.
- Active listing (or expected future listing) for transplant of any organ.
- Clinically important abnormal screening laboratory values, including but not limited to: hemoglobin <8 g/dl, white blood cell count <3000/mm3, platelets<80,000/mm3, international normalized ratio (INR) > 1.5 not due to a reversible cause (i.e. Coumadin), aspartate transaminase, alanine transaminase, or alkaline phosphatase > 3 times upper limit of normal, total bilirubin > 1.5 mg/dl.
- Serious comorbid illness that, in the opinion of the investigator, may compromise the safety or compliance of the patient or preclude successful completion of the study. Including, but not limited to: HIV, advanced liver or renal failure, class III/IV congestive heart failure, myocardial infarction, unstable angina, or cardiac revascularization within the last six months, or severe obstructive ventilatory defect.
- Any other condition that, in the opinion of the investigator, may compromise the safety or compliance of the patient or preclude successful completion of the study.
- Be an organ transplant recipient.
- Have a clinical history of malignancy within 5 years (i.e., patients with prior malignancy must be disease free for 5 years), except curatively-treated basal cell carcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma, melanoma in situ or cervical carcinoma if recurrence occurs.
- Have a non-pulmonary condition that limits lifespan to < 1 year.
- Have a history of drug or alcohol abuse within the past 24 months.
- Be serum positive for HIV, hepatitis B Surface Antigen (BsAg) or Viremic hepatitis C.
- Be currently participating (or participated within the previous 30 days) in an investigational therapeutic or device trial.
- Be a female who is pregnant, nursing, or of childbearing potential while not practicing effective contraceptive methods. Female patients must undergo a blood or urine pregnancy test at screening and within 36 hours prior to infusion.
- Have hypersensitivity to dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO)

overall_official.affiliation: ISCI / University of Miami Miller School of Medicine

facility.name: ISCI/University of Miami Miller School of Medicine

link.description: Interdisciplinary Stem Cell Institute at the University of Miami Miller School of Medicine

reference.citation: Golpanian S, DiFede DL, Pujol MV, Lowery MH, Levis-Dusseau S, Goldstein BJ, Schulman IH, Longsomboon B, Wolf A, Khan A, Heldman AW, Goldschmidt-Clermont PJ, Hare JM. Rationale and design of the allogeneiC human mesenchymal stem cells (hMSC) in patients with aging fRAilTy via intravenoUS delivery (CRATUS) study: A phase I/II, randomized, blinded and placebo controlled trial to evaluate the safety and potential efficacy of allogeneic human mesenchymal stem cell infusion in patients with aging frailty. Oncotarget. 2016 Mar 15;7(11):11899-912. doi: 10.18632/oncotarget.7727.

Tompkins BA, DiFede DL, Khan A, Landin AM, Schulman IH, Pujol MV, Heldman AW, Miki R, Goldschmidt-Clermont PJ, Goldstein BJ, Mushtaq M, Levis-Dusseau S, Byrnes JJ, Lowery M, Natsumeda M, Delgado C, Saltzman R, Vidro-Casiano M, Da Fonseca M, Golpanian S, Premer C, Medina A, Valasaki K, Florea V, Anderson E, El-Khorazaty J, Mendizabal A, Green G, Oliva AA, Hare JM. Allogeneic Mesenchymal Stem Cells Ameliorate Aging Frailty: A Phase II Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Clinical Trial. J Gerontol A Biol Sci Med Sci. 2017 Oct 12;72(11):1513-1522. doi: 10.1093/gerona/glx137.

Golpanian S, DiFede DL, Khan A, Schulman IH, Landin AM, Tompkins BA, Heldman AW, Miki R, Goldstein BJ, Mushtaq M, Levis-Dusseau S, Byrnes JJ, Lowery M, Natsumeda M, Delgado C, Saltzman R, Vidro-Casiano M, Pujol MV, Da Fonseca M, Oliva AA Jr, Green G, Premer C, Medina A, Valasaki K, Florea V, Anderson E, El-Khorazaty J, Mendizabal A, Goldschmidt-Clermont PJ, Hare JM. Allogeneic Human Mesenchymal Stem Cell Infusions for Aging Frailty. J Gerontol A Biol Sci Med Sci. 2017 Oct 12;72(11):1505-1512. doi: 10.1093/gerona/glx056.

outcome.description: Incidence of any treatment-emergent serious adverse events (SAE), defined as the composite of: death, non-fatal pulmonary embolism, stroke, hospitalization for worsening dyspnea and clinically significant laboratory test abnormalities. group.title: Randomized Phase - Group C
group.description: Group C - Placebo delivered via peripheral intravenous infusion. Participants in this group have the option to receive one additional infusion of 100million allo-hMSCs/kg with a 12 to 18 month interval. Allogeneic Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells (allo-hMSCs): Allogeneic Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells (allo-hMSCs) administered by peripheral intravenous infusion Placebo: Placebo administered by peripheral intravenous infusion.

group.title: Addendum B - Antibiotic Free Cell Group
group.description: Allogeneic Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells (allo-hMSCs): 100 million penicillin/streptomycin-free allo-hMSCs/kg delivered via peripheral intravenous infusion. Participants in this group have the option to receive an additional 3 infusions of 100million allo-hMSCs/kg per infusion with a 12 to 18 month interval. Allogeneic Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells (allo-hMSCs): Allogeneic Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells (allo-hMSCs) administered by peripheral intravenous infusion Penicillin/Streptomycin-Free Allogeneic Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells (allo-hMSCs): Penicillin/Streptomycin-Free Allogeneic Human Mesenchymal Stem Cells (allo-hMSCs) administered by peripheral intravenous infusion.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.organization: University of Miami, Miller School of Medicine - Interdisciplinary Stem Cell Institute (ISCI)
